CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: With deep understanding of efficient photoinduced electron transfer within an interpenetrating network by simple blending π-conjugated polymers ( electron donor ) with fullerene derivatives ( electron acceptor ) , 1 bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) based on poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) : [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PCBM ) have been extensively investigated , leading to great progress in power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) of 4-5 % .

Let's think step by step.

1. π-conjugated polymers (electron donor): This refers to a class of polymers that have extended systems of delocalized electrons, allowing for efficient electron transfer. In this context, it is the material that donates electrons during the photoinduced electron transfer process.
2. fullerene derivatives (electron acceptor): These are materials that accept electrons during the photoinduced electron transfer process. In this context, they are the materials derived from fullerenes that act as the electron acceptors.
3. poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT): This is a specific type of π-conjugated polymer used as the electron donor material in the BHJ PSCs.
4. [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM): This is a specific type of fullerene derivative used as the electron acceptor material in the BHJ PSCs.

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

1. π-conjugated polymers (electron donor)
2. fullerene derivatives (electron acceptor)
3. poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)
4. [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. π-conjugated polymers (electron donor)
2. fullerene derivatives (electron acceptor)
3. poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)
4. [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM)

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to specific materials used in the context of the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| π-conjugated polymers (electron donor) |
| fullerene derivatives (electron acceptor) |
| poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT) |
| [6,6]-phenyl C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PCBM) |
